item.title: "Fear not."
item.description: "Despite life’s hardships, the message of the Lord to each of us is the same today as it was to the shepherds keeping watch two thousand years ago: 'Fear not.'" — L. Whitney Clayton

item.title: Rejoice
item.description: "This Christmas season, may we rejoice in the assurance that someone special—even our beloved and omnipotent Heavenly Father—is doing something special for us." —Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: How Will You Stand Tall in 2016?
item.description: How Will You Stand Tall in 2016?

item.title: A Row of Sunday Shoes
item.description: Sunday is the #Bestday.

item.title: Sunday Sounds Different
item.description: Hear the other side. Listen to the sounds of the Sabbath. #BestDay

item.title: Dominoes
item.description: So often, our acts of service consist of simple encouragement or of giving mundane help with mundane tasks, but what glorious consequences can flow from mundane acts and from small but deliberate deeds! …

item.title: Matthew 25:40
item.description: Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.

item.title: Travelling
item.description: Every day each of us faces a test. It is the test of our lifetimes: will we choose to believe in Him and allow the light of His gospel to grow within us, or will we refuse to believe and insist on traveling alone in the dark?

item.title: Stable Family
item.description: The members of a stable family know who they are, where they are going, and what they want to achieve.

item.title: Family Laboratory
item.description: The home is the laboratory of our lives, and what we learn there largely determines what we do when we leave there.

item.title: Personal Revelation
item.description: God is perfect and omnipotent... He is our Father, he loves us, and he offers the same opportunity to draw closer to him as would a loving friend. And you will do it in much the same way: speaking, listening, and doing.

item.title: General Conference Montage
item.description: The Apostles testimonies of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Personal Revelation
item.description: God is perfect and omnipotent... He is our Father, he loves us, and he offers the same opportunity to draw closer to him as would a loving friend. And you will do it in much the same way: speaking, listening, and doing.

item.title: General Conference Montage
item.description: The Apostles testimonies of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Light Switch
item.description: Nevertheless, spiritual light rarely comes to those who merely sit in darkness waiting for someone to flip a switch. It takes an act of faith to open our eyes to the Light of Christ.

item.title: Personal Revelation
item.description: A heart filled with gratitude for the blessings of life and an earnest desire to hear and follow the words of counsel will prepare the way for personal revelation

item.title: 80 Ideas for the Sabbath
item.description: 80 Ideas for the Sabbath

item.title: It Will All Work Out
item.description: When we offer our broken heart to Jesus Christ, He accepts our offering. He takes us back. No matter what losses, wounds, and rejection we have suffered, His grace and healing are mightier than all. 'It will all work out.'

item.title: He is there for us
item.description: For many, the infirmity of depression is painful or permanently disabling... Those who suffer this circumstance should remember that our Savior experienced this kind of pain also and that, through His Atonement, He offers the strength to bear it.

item.title: Service
item.description: It is only when we love God and Christ with all of our hearts, souls, and minds that we are able to share this love with our neighbors through acts of kindness and service—the way that the Savior would love and serve all of us if He were among us.

item.title: Why Does God Give us Commandments?
item.description: Have you ever wondered why God gives us commandments? It can feel restricting, but is that the reality?

item.title: Good Things to Share
item.description: Sharing what matters most is not unusual at all – what good things will you share?

item.title: Help or Hinder
item.description: Does technology help or hinder your worship?

item.title: Connect to the Spirit of God
item.description: We need a special place of refuge where we can wean ourselves from the distractions of our electronic devices by unplugging them so we can connect to the Spirit of God.

item.title: Family Night
item.description: Share your family night using #familynight

item.title: The Power of the Gospel in Your Pocket
item.description: With more gospel resources available in digital formats, we can seek inspiration, share the gospel, and prepare for Sunday quorums and classes on our electronic devices - anytime, anywhere.

item.title: Use Your Heart-Bruce D. Porter
item.description: Make prayer more than a routine check on a list. Use your heart. #Patience

item.title: To Love and To Serve-Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: Watch this message, then answer this question: Who has God given to you to love? #LoveOneAnother

item.title: Supernal Gift of Prayer-Richard G. Scott
item.description: No hour too late. No worry too small. No one too unworthy. #Prayer

item.title: Mountains to Climb–Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: We all have mountains to climb. To make it to the top, never give up. #Patience

item.title: Pray Always-David A. Bednar
item.description: It's important to create each day spiritually first.

item.title: A Lesson in Spelling–Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: A lesson in spelling from an apostle of God.#LoveOneAnother

item.title: Teaching By Faith-Robert D. Hales
item.description: Children need to know God and Jesus Christ will always love them and answer their prayers. This knowledge will bring them abiding strength.

item.title: Baby Steps-Joseph B. Wirthlin
item.description: Celebrate the small steps. #Patience

item.title: Unsinkable-Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: Unsinkable. #patience

item.title: Courage-2 Timothy 1:7
item.description: How do you find the courage to kick cancer, fight for your marriage, or defend your beliefs? Remember these three gifts from God. #courage

item.title: Transforming Power of Faith and Character
item.description: Transforming Power of Faith and Character

item.title: President Henry B. Eyring Testifies of Jesus Christ
item.description: President Eyring teaches that the Savior is mindful of us and will guide us through life’s trials.

item.title: Now Serving
item.description: Each day is full of small chances to do a little good.

item.title: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf Testifies of Jesus Christ
item.description: President Uchtdorf teaches that the Savior is mindful of us and will guide us through life’s trials.

item.title: Living the Gospel
item.description: We don't achieve spiritual progress in large increments all at once. It comes gradually and slowly. It requires patience and persistence. The council I would give, the observation I would make is; consistency in small things brings great blessings.

item.title: Living with Purpose and Real Intent
item.description: The gospel teaches us who we are and helps us maintain focus on our eternal purpose. Living with real intent ensures we reach the full measure of our creation.

item.title: Renaissance of Marriage
item.description: Hear what President Eyring says we all must do to have a renaissance of happy marriages and productive families.

item.title: Free Forever, to Act for Themselves
item.description: Elder D. Todd Christofferson explains how the real manifestation of God's love is His commandments and our agency.

item.title: More Diligent and Concerned at Home
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar suggests three ways each of us can become more diligent and concerned at home.

item.title: One Key to a Happy Family
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches that forgiveness is one of our best hopes for a happy family.

item.title: Willing to Change
item.description: God helps us change when we pray to Him with a humble heart.

item.title: Be Kind
item.description: Being kind helps set a good example in the community.

item.title: Crazy, Loud & Lovely
item.description: We want our children to be successful, and Heavenly Father wants the same for all of us as His children.

item.title: When Life Gets Tough
item.description: When life gets tough, prayer can help us know what to do.

item.title: Mission Call
item.description: The call to serve can bring joy and happiness.

item.title: He Understands
item.description: Christ understands what we're going through - even at our lowest moments.

item.title: He Loves Us
item.description: God loves and helps our families.

item.title: Saving Soles
item.description: Holding to the principles of the gospel can make us better in every way.

item.title: Quality Time
item.description: Be close to the ones you love to stay close to the ones you love.

item.title: Fashion & Faith
item.description: Working together in a marriage helps us achieve our potential.

item.title: Families Sacrifice, Give & Love
item.description: “I believe families are there to help each other."

item.title: Missing Mom
item.description: The death of a loved one can be hard. Faith in Christ can ease that pain.

item.title: Work, Part of the Plan
item.description: The principle of work is an important part of Heavenly Father's plan for us.

item.title: Even If
item.description: Reaching our potential requires working together as a couple.

item.title: #SHAREGOODNESS
item.description: What we share reflects who we are. Are you sharing His goodness?

item.title: Blessing of Creativity
item.description: Sharing creativity can give us an appreciation of our Creator.

item.title: Learning Appreciation
item.description: Doing good things for others helps us understand Heavenly Father better.

item.title: This is My Mother
item.description: Family history work can help us see how we're alike.

item.title: Divine Potential
item.description: Becoming like Heavenly Father requires overcoming difficult times.

item.title: Here to Love
item.description: "Heavenly Father put us on earth to serve and love each other."

item.title: Challenges Strengthen Us
item.description: Our challenges strengthen us and teach us how to act.

item.title: Blessed With Great Joy
item.description: Taking care of a loved one can bring great blessings of joy.

item.title: Because He Served
item.description: Seeing what Jesus did helps us know what to do.

item.title: See and Recognize
item.description: We're all children of God. This knowledge can help us be kind.

item.title: He's On My Side
item.description: Knowing God wants us to succeeds can give us courage.

item.title: Happily Ever After (So Far)
item.description: Happyily ever after can get a good start at the temple.

item.title: There to Help
item.description: "We learn how to sacrifice, give and love through families."

item.title: What Helps Me Overcome Challenges?
item.description: Daily challenges and stress can be overcome with the help of faith and prayer.

item.title: Focus to Remember
item.description: When we focus our lives on the Savior, we remember who we really are.

item.title: After Work
item.description: "I believe it's important to spend time with my children."

item.title: Honesty, Trust, Integrity
item.description: We earn the trust of others by being honest.
